comment:
* The {@link AdvertiseSettings} provide a way to adjust advertising preferences for each
 * Bluetooth LE advertisement instance. Use {@link AdvertiseSettings.Builder} to create an
 * instance of this class.

variables.name: ADVERTISE_MODE_LOW_POWER
variables.comment:
* Perform Bluetooth LE advertising in low power mode. This is the default and preferred
     * advertising mode as it consumes the least power.

variables.name: ADVERTISE_MODE_BALANCED
variables.comment:
* Perform Bluetooth LE advertising in balanced power mode. This is balanced between advertising
     * frequency and power consumption.

variables.name: ADVERTISE_MODE_LOW_LATENCY
variables.comment:
* Perform Bluetooth LE advertising in low latency, high power mode. This has the highest power
     * consumption and should not be used for continuous background advertising.

variables.name: ADVERTISE_TX_POWER_ULTRA_LOW
variables.comment:
* Advertise using the lowest transmission (TX) power level. Low transmission power can be used
     * to restrict the visibility range of advertising packets.

variables.name: ADVERTISE_TX_POWER_LOW
variables.comment: * Advertise using low TX power level.

variables.name: ADVERTISE_TX_POWER_MEDIUM
variables.comment: * Advertise using medium TX power level.

variables.name: ADVERTISE_TX_POWER_HIGH
variables.comment:
* Advertise using high TX power level. This corresponds to largest visibility range of the
     * advertising packet.

variables.name: LIMITED_ADVERTISING_MAX_MILLIS
variables.comment: * The maximum limited advertisement duration as specified by the Bluetooth SIG

methods.name: public int getTxPowerLevel()
methods.comment: * Returns the TX power level for advertising.

methods.name: public boolean isConnectable()
methods.comment: * Returns whether the advertisement will indicate connectable.

methods.name: public int getTimeout()
methods.comment: * Returns the advertising time limit in milliseconds.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)
